p:
Applying theoretical advances made possible through genomics studies can have practical outcomes, such as enabling plant breeders to accelerate the domestication of promising wild species. For example, in south‐western Australia where the legume farming system was dominated by clover and annual medics ( Medicago spp.) prior to the 1990s, it became possible to expand legume diversity by incorporating traits such as deeper root systems, acid‐soil tolerant root nodule symbiosis, and pest and disease tolerance, and eight species of legumes were newly domesticated including
Ornithopus sativus ,
Biserrula pelecinus ,
Trifolium glanduliferum ,
Trifolium dasyurum ,
Trifolium spumosum ,
Trifolium purpureum , Medicago sphaerocarpos (Nichols et al., 2007; Nichols, Loi, Nutt, Snowball, & Revell, 2010), and
Melilotus siculus (common name messina; Rogers et al., 2011).
